{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3609150,"name":"Jugad S.","username":"jsingh","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/c37758/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-05-01T20:42:48.365Z","cooked":"

We are trying to use Megatag 2 but when we show the position on AdvantageScope, it appears to move whenever we rotate. We are calling the get robot orientation properly from our Pigeon 2. Our code.
Thanks

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":33,"updated_at":"2025-05-01T20:42:48.365Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":377,"readers_count":376,"score":130.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":501027,"topic_slug":"megatag2-limelight-3g-translating","display_username":"Jugad S.","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/jugads/1391_COMP/blob/HoustonCMP/src/main/java/frc/robot/subsystems/CommandSwerveDrivetrain.java","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"1391_COMP/src/main/java/frc/robot/subsystems/CommandSwerveDrivetrain.java at HoustonCMP · jugads/1391_COMP · GitHub","clicks":21}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69335,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/megatag2-limelight-3g-translating/501027/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3609189,"name":"","username":"AMysterium","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/amysterium/{size}/167374_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-01T21:32:28.003Z","cooked":"

A little more information would’ve been useful, but here are my thoughts.

First, what happens if you use MT1 instead? If it seems normal with that change, here’s my theory:

It looks you apply your gyro updates, then vision updates, and then set the robot orientation. If you think about it, this means that when you are seeing a tag, you are kind of ignoring gyro changes in favor of vision, which is a problem when using MT2 which uses your gyro value as a ground truth. This is just in theory though, and could be wrong.

What information would you like? I’m happy to provide. I worked on it further and pushed new code just now. If you want, take another look and let me know what you think. We used MT1 all season and it was sometimes just a little bit off. But, it worked well and consistently for us.

Ok, so did it work with the changes or will you have to wait to test?

Scrolling through the commit (on my phone rn so its a bit harder), is there a reason you changed to use the MT x and y, and then the gyro yaw? Probably not the ideal approach, since it relies on your gyro yaw being initialized exactly correct which it may not always be.

In terms of improving vision performance, what exactly wasn’t great? MT2 could be the solution, but it also might not change much.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":33,"updated_at":"2025-05-01T22:20:00.825Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":279,"readers_count":278,"score":55.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":501027,"topic_slug":"megatag2-limelight-3g-translating","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":69335,"username":"jsingh","name":"Jugad S.","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/c37758/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":46476,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1648M | 422AM | Programming"},"post_url":"/t/megatag2-limelight-3g-translating/501027/4","custom_user_title":"1648M | 422AM | Programming","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3609276,"name":null,"username":"Rocco","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/13edae/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-05-02T00:18:47.141Z","cooked":"

After looking at your CommandSwerveDrivetrain.java and Robot.java, I have a few questions:

  1. I don’t see LimelightHelpers.setCameraPose_RobotSpace() in your robot program. Have you configured your camera’s robot-space pose in the limelight web UI? If you haven’t, the limelight will think it’s in the very center of your robot, and seeing a tag at an off-angle may cause estimates to be worse.
  2. Why initialize a SwerveDrivePoseEstimator in CommandSwerveDrivetrain? It already has a pose estimator built in that runs at a higher frequency than the robot program, and is automatically updated with module positions and yaw behind the scenes. You can use getState().Pose to get the yaw for LimelightHelpers.SetRobotOrientation(), and this.addVisionMeasurement() to add MT2 estimates.
  3. It’s not recommended to add the pigeon yaw back into the pose estimator with addVisionMeasurement() because it has already been incorporated to the pose estimator. As shown in the Limelight documentation, you should set the vision measurement standard deviation for the yaw to an extremely high number. This is because MT2 yaw is basically an outdated copy of the last yaw you gave it.

If you need a reference for using MT2, CTRE has an example project you can view.

Grieshop","username":"CakeDeer6","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cakedeer6/{size}/264680_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-02T02:20:50.121Z","cooked":"

I highly doubt that’s the issue. The pose estimation calculations are done asynchronously from the sending of gyro information. Also, the gyro shouldn’t be updating by more than a couple fractions of a degree every periodic cycle when testing, which wouldn’t be enough to significantly throw off the pose. To me, this sounds like the orientation of the limelight wasn’t set quite correctly.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":33,"updated_at":"2025-05-02T02:20:50.121Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":190,"readers_count":189,"score":43.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":501027,"topic_slug":"megatag2-limelight-3g-translating","display_username":"Ethan Grieshop","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":46476,"username":"AMysterium","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/amysterium/{size}/167374_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62698,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4611 Programmer + Driver"},"post_url":"/t/megatag2-limelight-3g-translating/501027/6","custom_user_title":"4611 Programmer + Driver","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3609400,"name":"","username":"AMysterium","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/amysterium/{size}/167374_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-02T05:25:56.424Z","cooked":"

Yes, so suppose the robot turns 0.5 degrees in the cycle. The pose estimator uses that change to update the current robot pose in the pose estimator. Then, it uses the limelight pose, which is based on the pose estimator’s rotation in the previous cycle, and thus returns a pose with the rotation from the previous cycle. They aren’t using stdevs, but I’d guess the defaults are pretty low. The pose estimator would then replace the 0.5 degree change with the vision update, which means the gyro turning has not actually changed the robot pose at all.

This happening over many cycles could reflect in translation of the robot when rotating in place.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":33,"updated_at":"2025-05-02T05:27:05.694Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":176,"readers_count":175,"score":40.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":501027,"topic_slug":"megatag2-limelight-3g-translating","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":62698,"username":"CakeDeer6","name":"Ethan Grieshop","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cakedeer6/{size}/264680_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":46476,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1648M | 422AM | Programming"},"post_url":"/t/megatag2-limelight-3g-translating/501027/7","custom_user_title":"1648M | 422AM | Programming","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3609499,"name":"Ethan Grieshop","username":"CakeDeer6","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cakedeer6/{size}/264680_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-02T11:41:39.247Z","cooked":"

Limelight’s are almost always using an old gyro rotation value though. When you call the setRobotSpace function (idk what it’s called off the top of my head), all you’re doing is sending an array over networktables to the limelight. The limelight sends any calculated poses back to the robot over networktables as well. Since both actions have latency, and the limelight calculates poses asynchronously from the robot’s periodic loop, the point that you send your gyro angle to the limelight has a very low chance of having any bearing on the measurement you receive from it.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":33,"updated_at":"2025-05-02T11:41:39.247Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":153,"readers_count":152,"score":60.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":501027,"topic_slug":"megatag2-limelight-3g-translating","display_username":"Ethan Grieshop","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":46476,"username":"AMysterium","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/amysterium/{size}/167374_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62698,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4611 Programmer + Driver"},"post_url":"/t/megatag2-limelight-3g-translating/501027/8","custom_user_title":"4611 Programmer + Driver","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3609569,"name":"","username":"enc0unt3r","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/enc0unt3r/{size}/202939_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-02T12:59:09.858Z","cooked":"

At first I thought it would be the time stamp issue but after double checking the code it was not. It can be a callibration issue then. Have you callibrated your Limelight and is the issue more serious when the tag is next to the edges of the vision?

It didn’t work with the changes. To answer a few other questions, the LL pose is configured in the web UI. We will try using the internal pose estimator. Later, I will send a video that should help everyone to know what exactly the issue is.

I noticed that in your drivetrain periodic() method, you have this:

github.com

jugads/1391_COMP/blob/HoustonCMP/src/main/java/frc/robot/subsystems/CommandSwerveDrivetrain.java#L279


      
    
          
  1. }
    2. 
          
  2. // if our angular velocity is greater than 360 degrees per second, ignore vision updates
    3. 
          
  3. 
          
  4. 
          
  5.   var array = new double[] {
    6. 
          
  6.       getPose().getX(),
    7. 
          
  7.       getPose().getY(),
    8. 
          
  8.       getPose().getRotation().getRadians(),
    9. 
          
  9.   };
    10. 
          
  10.   SmartDashboard.putNumberArray("MyPose", array);
    11. 
          
  11.   SmartDashboard.putNumberArray("Left LL", new double[]{getLeftLLPose().getX(), getLeftLLPose().getY(), getLeftLLPose().getRotation().getDegrees()});
    12. 
          
  12. //   // SmartDashboard.putNumber("Rot", getPose().getRotation().getDegrees());
    13. 
          
  13.   /*
    14. 
          
  14.    * Periodically try to apply the operator perspective.
    15. 
          
  15.    * If we haven't applied the operator perspective before, then we should apply it regardless of DS state.
    16. 
          
  16.    * This allows us to correct the perspective in case the robot code restarts mid-match.
    17. 
          
  17.    * Otherwise, only check and apply the operator perspective if the DS is disabled.
    18. 
          
  18.    * This ensures driving behavior doesn't change until an explicit disable event occurs during testing.
    19. 
          
  19.    */
    20. 
          
  20.   if (!m_hasAppliedOperatorPerspective || DriverStation.isDisabled()) {
    21. 
          
  21.       DriverStation.getAlliance().ifPresent(allianceColor -> {
    22.

If the green robot in your video is “Left LL”, the crazy rotation is because you are logging degrees when you should be logging radians. I recommend you fix that first.

And btw it’s possible to put a field2d onto the dashboard, which contains a Pose2d as a member. We were using that like this:

targetStationPoseField2d.setRobotPose(chassis.generateStationPose());
SmartDashboard.putData("SuperStructure/targetStationPose", targetStationPoseField2d);

You can try that too.
